login.tagline: A Forest of Podcasts, Rooted in the Spirit of Self-Hosting
login.first_time_setup_welcome: Welcome to Pinepods! This appears to be your first time logging in. To start, let's get some basic information about your time and time zone preferences. This will determine how times appear throughout the app.

settings.username_min_length: Username must be at least 4 characters long
settings.please_enter_valid_email: Please enter a valid email address
settings.password_min_length: Password must be at least 6 characters long
settings.choose_preferred_theme: Choose your preferred theme. Your selection will sync across all your Pinepods applications.
settings.guest_user_description: You can choose to enable or disable the Guest user here. It's always disabled by default. Basically, enabling the guest user enables a button on the login page to login as guest. This guest user essentially has access to add podcasts and listen to them in an ephemeral sense. Once logged out, the session is deleted along with any podcasts the Guest saved. If your Pinepods server is exposed to the internet you probably want to disable this option. It's meant more for demos or if you want to allow people to quickly listen to a podcast using your server.
settings.change_user_fields_instructions: Change the fields below coresponding to the user details you want to edit. Do not add values to fields you don't want to change. Leave those blank.
settings.user_management_description: You can manage users here. Click a user in the table to manage settings for that existing user or click 'Create New' to add a new user. Note that the background_tasks user will always show and cannot be edited.

shared_episode.something_went_wrong: Something seems to have gone wrong. A straightup server disconnect maybe? Did you browse here directly? That's not how this app works. It needs the context to browse around. I honestly don't have anything else for you as this shouldn't happen. This is embarrasing.

virtual_list.select_newer_episodes: Select this episode and all newer episodes
virtual_list.select_older_episodes: Select this episode and all older episodes

youtube_layout.enter_channel_name: Enter a channel name in the search bar above.
youtube_layout.successfully_subscribed: Successfully subscribed to channel. Videos will be processed in background.

navigation.unmatched_podcasts_notification: 📻 You have {count} podcast(s) that aren't matched to Podcast Index. Visit the Match Podcast Index settings to enable host and guest information.

oauth_callback.first_time_welcome: Welcome to Pinepods! This appears to be your first time logging in. To start, let's get some basic information about your time and time zone preferences. This will determine how times appear throughout the app.
oauth_callback.username_conflict: Unable to create account - username already exists
oauth_callback.unexpected_error: An unexpected error occurred during login.

people_subs.subscribe_to_hosts_message: Subscribe to podcast hosts and guests to see their latest episodes here!

person.no_podcasts_message: This person doesn't seem to appear in any podcasts. Are you sure you got the right person?
person.add_podcasts_message: You can add new podcasts by using the search bar above. Search for your favorite podcast and click the plus button to add it.
person.no_episodes_message: This podcast strangely doesn't have any episodes. Try a more mainstream one maybe?

playlist_detail.fresh_releases_empty: No new episodes have been released in the last 24 hours. Check back later for fresh content!
playlist_detail.currently_listening_empty: Start listening to some episodes and they'll appear here for easy access.
playlist_detail.almost_done_empty: You don't have any episodes that are near completion. Keep listening!
playlist_detail.no_episodes_match_criteria: No episodes match the current playlist criteria. Try adjusting the filters or add more podcasts.

validation.username_min_length: Username must be at least 4 characters long
validation.password_min_length: Password must be at least 6 characters long

user_stats.about_text: Thanks for using Pinepods! This app was born from a love for podcasts, of homelabs, and a desire to have a secure and central location to manage personal data. Feel free to reach out for questions and open an issue if you have ideas for new features. Pull Requests on this software are welcome and encouraged. If you feel that you've gotten use out of this software and are thankful for it's existence donations to my Buymeacoffee are welcome but never required. Lastly, this app will ALWAYS remain open source.

podcasts.delete_confirmation_text: Are you sure you want to delete the podcast from the database? This will remove it from every aspect of the app. Meaning this will remove any saved, downloaded, or queued episodes for this podcast. It will also remove any history that includes it.
podcasts.custom_podcast_instructions: Simply enter the feed url, optional credentials, and click the button below. This is great in case you subscibe to premium podcasts and they aren't availble in The Pocast Index or other indexing services.
podcasts.no_podcasts_found_description: You can add new podcasts by using the search bar above. Search for your favorite podcast and click the plus button to add it.

api_keys.api_keys_description: You can request a Pinepods API Key here. These keys can then be used in conjunction with other Pinepods apps (like Pinepods Firewood) to connect them to the Pinepods server. In addition, you can also use an API Key to authenticate to this server from any other Pinepods server. Sort of like using a different server as a client for this one.
api_keys.delete_api_key_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this API Key? This action cannot be undone.
api_keys.api_key_save_instructions: Copy the API Key Listed Below. Be sure to save it in a safe place. You will only ever be able to view it once. You can always just create a new one if you lose it.

backup_server.scheduled_backups_description: Configure automatic backups to run on a schedule. Backups are saved to the mounted backup directory and use the database credentials from your container environment.
backup_server.manual_backup_description: Create a backup of the entire server database immediately. Choose to download the backup file or save it to the server's backup directory.
backup_server.download_backup_description: Downloads a .sql backup file directly to your computer.
backup_server.save_to_backup_description: Creates a backup file in the server's mounted backup directory using container credentials.
backup_server.backup_loading_message: This may take a few minutes for large databases. Please don't close this window.
backup_server.backup_error: Error backing up server - Maybe wrong password?:
backup_server.manual_backup_started: Manual backup '{}' started successfully. Check the backup directory.

custom_feed.add_feed_description: Use this to add a custom feed to your podcasts. Simply enter the feed url and click the button below. This is great in case you subscibe to premium podcasts and they aren't availble in The Pocast Index or other indexing services. After adding here, podcasts will show up and be available just like any others.

download_settings.server_download_description: You can choose to enable or disable server downloads here. This does not effect local downloads. There's two types of downloads in Pinepods. Local and Server. Local downloads would be where a user clicks download and it downloads the podcast to their local machine. A server download is when a user downloads the podcast to the server specifically. This is meant as an archival option. If you're concerned the podcast may not be always available you may want to archive it using this option. See the Pinepods documentation for mapping a specific location (like a NAS) as the location server downloads download to. You might want to turn this option off if you have self service enabled or your Pinepods server accessible to the internet. You wouldn't want any random user filling up your server.

export_settings.export_description: You can export an OPML file containing your Podcasts here. This file can then be imported if you want to switch to a different podcast app or simply want a backup of your files just in case. Note, if you are exporting to add your podcasts to AntennaPod the Nextcloud Options below might better suit your needs. If you're an admin a full server backup might be a better solution as well on the Admin Settings Page.

import_options.import_description: You can Import an OPML of podcasts here. If you're migrating from a different podcast app this is probably the solution you want. Most podcast apps allow you to export a backup of your saved podcasts to an OPML file and this option can easily import them into Pinepods. Note that this process can take awhile and you don't have to stay on this page while it imports. If you think it might be stuck, it's probably not.
import_options.import_tip: 💡 After importing, head over to the Match Podcast Index area to match podcasts with their index counterpart. This allows for host and guest integration throughout PinePods.
import_options.import_verification_text: The following podcasts were found. Please unselect any podcasts you don't want to add, and then click the button below. A large amount of podcasts will take a little while to parse all the feeds and add them. The loading animation will disappear once all complete. Be patient!
import_options.opml_import_completed: OPML Import Completed! After importing head over the Match Podcast Index area to match podcasts with their index counterpart. This allows for host and guest integration throughout PinePods.

start_page_options.start_page_description: Choose your preferred start page. This is the page you'll see first when opening Pinepods.

email_settings.email_settings_description: Pinepods can optionally send email notifications for certain events. To enable email functionality, please configure the SMTP settings below. The Pinepods server will use these details to send emails. If you're using Gmail or other OAuth providers, you may need to create an app-specific password instead of using your regular password.

mfa_settings.scan_qr_or_enter_code: Either scan the QR code with your authenticator app or enter the code manually. Then enter the code from your authenticator app to verify.
mfa_settings.mfa_description: You can setup edit, or remove MFA for your account here. MFA will only be prompted when new authentication is needed.

nextcloud_options.failed_to_load_default_gpodder_device: Failed to load default GPodder device:
nextcloud_options.could_not_find_device_with_id: Could not find device with ID:
nextcloud_options.failed_to_perform_initial_sync: Failed to perform initial sync with GPodder:
nextcloud_options.no_device_selected_for_initial_sync: No device selected for initial sync
nextcloud_options.gpodder_sync_description: GPodder synchronization allows you to manage your podcast subscriptions across multiple devices. Here you can manage devices registered with your GPodder account and control synchronization.
nextcloud_options.no_devices_found: No devices found. Create your first device below.

oidc.use_this_url_when_configuring: Use this URL when configuring your OIDC provider's callback/redirect settings.
oidc.no_oidc_providers_configured: No OIDC providers configured yet. Add one to enable single sign-on.

playback_settings.failed_to_fetch_auto_complete_seconds: Failed to fetch auto complete seconds:
playback_settings.failed_to_update_auto_complete_seconds: Failed to update auto complete seconds:
playback_settings.playback_preferences_description: Configure your playback preferences including default playback speed and auto-complete behavior.
playback_settings.auto_complete_description: Episodes with this many seconds or less remaining will be automatically marked as complete. Set to 0 to disable.

notifications.username_password_or_token: Choose either username/password OR access token, not both

podcast_index_matching.no_unmatched_podcasts: No podcasts need Podcast Index matching.
podcast_index_matching.no_ignored_podcasts: No podcasts are ignored from index matching.

restore_server.file_size_too_large: File size too large. Maximum size is 100MB.
restore_server.restoration_success: Server restoration completed successfully! The application will restart.

rss_feeds.rss_feed_description: RSS feeds allow you to subscribe to your Pinepods queue using any RSS reader. This creates a personal RSS feed that includes all queued episodes.

user_self_service.self_service_description: You can enable or disable user self service setup here. That is as it sounds. Once enabled there's a button on the login screen that allows users to set themselves up. It's highly recommended that if you enable this option you disable server downloads and setup the email settings so users can do self service password resets. If you'd rather not enable this you can just set new users up manually using User Settings above.

downloads.no_downloaded_episodes_description: This is where episode downloads will appear. To download an episode you can open the context menu on an episode and select Download Episode. It will then download to the server and show up here!

downloads_tauri.switch_to_online_mode: Switch to Online Mode (Sign In Required)
downloads_tauri.no_downloaded_episodes_description: This is where local episode downloads will appear. To download an episode you can open the context menu on an episode and select Local Download. It will then download to your device locally and show up here!

episode.share_link_description: Share this link with anyone you'd like to be able to listen to this episode. They don't even need an account on the server to use this!
episode.current_page_link_description: If they do have an account you can just send the user the current link on this web page:
episode.add_podcast_to_enable_actions: Add podcast to enable more actions
episode.this_item_contains_no_media: This item contains no media file
episode.something_went_wrong_description: Something seems to have gone wrong. A straightup server disconnect maybe? Did you browse here directly? That's not how this app works. It needs the context to browse around. I honestly don't have anything else for you as this shouldn't happen. This is embarrasing.

episodes_layout.add_remove_podcast: Click to add or remove podcast from feed
episodes_layout.podcast_specific_settings: Click to setup podcast specific settings
episodes_layout.rss_feed_note: NOTE: You must have RSS feeds enabled in your settings for the link below to work
episodes_layout.rss_feed_instruction: Use this RSS feed URL in your favorite podcast app to subscribe to this podcast:
episodes_layout.rss_feed_warning: This URL includes your API key, so keep it private. This is going to change very shortly in a future release to a temporary key so that you can share these links.
episodes_layout.playback_speed_description: Sets the default playback speed for this podcast. Range: 0.5x - 2.0x. Reset to use your global default.
episodes_layout.youtube_limit_description: Adjusts how long Youtube Feed audio is retained when downloaded to be streamed via the server. Youtube episodes will be removed after to free up space.
episodes_layout.download_all_confirmation: Are you sure you want to download all episodes from the current podcast to the server? If the podcast has a lot of episodes this might take awhile.
episodes_layout.delete_podcast_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the podcast from the database? This will remove it from every aspect of the app. Meaning this will remove any saved, downloaded, or queued episodes for this podcast. It will also remove any history that includes it.
episodes_layout.no_episodes_description: This podcast strangely doesn't have any episodes. Try a more mainstream one maybe?

feed.no_recent_episodes_description: You can add new podcasts by using the search bar above. Search for your favorite podcast and click the plus button to add it.

gen_components.valid_email_required: Please enter a valid email address

history.no_episode_history_description: This one is pretty straightforward. You should get listening! Podcasts you listen to will show up here!

home.welcome_description: Start by adding some podcasts using the search bar above.

host_component.add_hosts_here: Add hosts for this podcast here

playlists.system_playlists_info: System playlists cannot be deleted and are not selectable.
playlists.create_new_playlist_to_start: Create a new playlist to get started

playlists.delete_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this playlist?

safehtml.start_episode_first: Please start playing this episode before using timecodes.
safehtml.start_episode_first_audio: Please start playing the episode first before using timecodes.

saved.save_episodes_instructions: You can save episodes by clicking the context button on each episode and clicking 'Save Episode'. Doing this will save episodes here for easy access when you want to return to them.

search.search_for_podcast_episode_description: Search for a podcast, episode, or description
search.try_different_search: Perhaps try again, but search for something slightly different :/

queue.queue_episodes_instructions: You can queue episodes by clicking the context button on each episode and clicking 'Queue Episode'. Doing this will play episodes in order of the queue after the currently playing episode is complete.
queue.no_queued_episodes_found_state_none: No Queued Episodes Found - State is None
